resources.string: The spectacular-looking Ark, a royal town-within-a-town, is Bukhara\'s oldest structure, occupied from the 5th century right up until 1920, when it was bombed by the Red Army. For centuries it was the residence of the emirs of Bukhara. It\'s about 80% ruins but there are still some remaining royal quarters, now housing several interesting museums.

Labi Hauz which is translated as \'at the pond\' is one of the central squares of Bukhara situated in the southeast part of the city. The architectural ensemble was created in the 16th-17th centuries. The square has the form of an irregular polygon with the Divan-Begi madrasah in the eastern part. In the western part, opposite the madrasah, is the Divan-Begi khanqah.

This minaret has stood for over 9 centuries and is the only thing spared by Gengis Khan when ransacking the city. The Kalyan (great) minaret is a example of superior civil engineering and architectural creation. It has 14 different ornamental bands and was the first to utilise the glazed blue times that the Timurids later saturated Central Asia with. The rotunda has 16 arched fenestrations from which the call to prayer was made. It is a Djuma mosque, intended for the large numbers that attend Friday services.

Minorai Kalon Hotels is located just few steps from the famous architectural symbol of Bukhara, the pearl of architectural ensemble Poi-Kalyan, Kalyan Minaret. Most rooms of the hotel have a great view of the minaret, in honor of which the hotel was named. \n\nRooms of the hotel are equipped with everything necessary for your comfort and nice pastime. On the root of the hotel there is the terrace, overlooking ancient Bukhara

Zargaron Plaza Hotel was opened in 2009. The hotel is located 3 km from the airport and 12 km from the train station. It is 1.5 km from the old town (it is a good 15-20 minutes walk to the old city) and the historical part of Bukhara. A very nice early morning walk that surely is recommended-get out of bed before 6 am and have breakfast when you return (or in the old town). The lobby is frequently used by photographers shooting bridal pictures.
Featuring Uzbek decor, Modarixon Hotel is located in Bukhara, a short walk from Cherny Nor Monument. Free WiFi access and private parking are available.

TYPE OF KITCHEN
Asian

SPECIALIZED MENU
Suitable for Vegetarians, Vegan Options

MEAL TIME
